metadata.Title: CVE-2023-5422 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description: The functions to fetch e-mail via POP3 or IMAP as well as sending e-mail via SMTP use OpenSSL for static SSL or TLS based communication. As the SSL_get_verify_result() function is not used the certificated is trusted always and it can not be ensured that the certificate satisfies all necessary security requirements. This could allow an attacker to use an invalid certificate to claim to be a trusted host, use expired certificates, or conduct other attacks that could be detected if the certificate is properly validated. This issue affects OTRS: from 7.0.X before 7.0.47, from 8.0.X before 8.0.37; ((OTRS)) Community Edition: from 6.0.X through 6.0.34.

notes.Note: sbeattie> possibly fixed in otrs2 in 6.0.35, which was a bunch of fixes backported from znuny; this may mean that it was already fixed in znuny

criterions.comment: otrs2 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
